results.title: The Catalysts
results.creator_credit: R and R Productions and Ron V. Brown
results.brief_description: Looks at the work being done by people throughout Victoria in the field of Community Education and Services. Community Education Officers act as a catalyst advising people how best to update their qualifications.

results.title: The Cat in the hat
results.brief_description: Impulsive and imaginative, the Cat romps through the house dispelling boredom for a brother and sister on a rainy day, while their mother is away. Invites children to become self-sufficient in their use of time. Adapted from the book by Dr. Seuss.

results.title: The Cat family
results.brief_description: Shows how a number of animals may differ in size, colour and habitat, yet possess common characteristics. Studies the domestic cat and includes scenes of the larger cats, including the tiger, lynx and leopard. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Cat and the fiddler
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Hayes, Thomas Sand Enterprises, ACI Films and Jane Startz
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a travelling fiddler and his dancing cat whose performances earns a living for both of them. The king tries to buy the cat, however it will only dance for the fiddler. He plays but the court and the king cannot stop dancing. Based on the book by Jacky Jeter, illustrated by Lionel kalish. The original illustrations from the book are used in the film. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeffrey Hayes, Thomas Sand Enterprises, ACI Films and Jane Startz

results.title: The Cat and the collector
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A film which tells a story with drawings of how an old man befriends a stray cat and learns about the nature of cats. Based on the book of the same title written and illustrated by Linda Slovach. Narrated by Emery Battis. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat = A Macska
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hernadi and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Animalia”.
Protagonists of the film are two mice who are engaged in complicated scientific debate and keep arguing until they are unceremoniously swallowed by a cat. All things are relative.

results.title: The Cat's meow
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Oxford Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A live action cat-and-mouse story about several playful mice, an inquisitive house cat, and his cousin, the alley cat, which is shown as a serious struggle for survival and a comic standoff between lively opponents. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Cashmere story
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and Robert Pringle and Son
results.brief_description: Hawick, in Scotland, has been the centre of a thriving knitting trade for over 200 years. Shows the raw material of the industry, obtained from the Kashmir goat in the mountains beyond the Himalayas, transformed into the finished product. Highly skilled workers are seen making the articles for which the industry is justly famous. Historic Edinburgh provides the setting for a display of fashionable sweater designs.

results.title: The Case of the travelling garden
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Raymond Leach
results.brief_description: The Department of Customs checks on all plants being brought into Australia and administers agricultural quarantine regulations. Travellers are required to leave behind all fruit and vegetables, flowers and bulbs for these may be disease-carrying. Australia is fortunate in having so much agriculture which is free from any overseas pests and diseases. Uses animation. (For the Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign, 1972).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Scully, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Raymond Leach
